abstract: Jihua Group, a military supplier, plans to raise up to $469 million from an initial public offering in Shanghai, Finance Asia reported. The Chinese regulator is set to study the application on April 28.
snippet: Jihua Group, a military supplier, plans to raise up to $469 million from an initial public offering in Shanghai, Finance Asia reported. The Chinese regulator is set to study the application on April 28.
lead_paragraph: Jihua Group of China plans to raise up to 3.2 billion yuan ($469 million) from an initial public offering in Shanghai, Finance Asia reported. The Chinese regulator is set to study the application on April 28.

abstract: With Shanghai preparing for the World Expo, stores have moved bootleg DVDs and CDs to back rooms as China hides a trade that is usually out in the open.
snippet: With Shanghai preparing for the World Expo, stores have moved bootleg DVDs and CDs to back rooms as China hides a trade that is usually out in the open.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — The latest mystery in Shanghai, complete with sliding bookshelves, secret passageways and contraband goods, is this: Why are all the popular DVDs and CDs missing from this city’s shops?

headline.main: In Shanghai, Hiding Bootlegs Before the World Visits
headline.print_headline: In Shanghai, Hiding Bootlegs Before the World Visits
